intro: Lindsaea triquetra, commonly known as the three-angled lindsaea, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, triquetrous (three-angled) rhizomes and its delicate, pinnate fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its spores are produced in sori that are arranged in a unique, linear pattern on the underside of the fronds. Lindsaea triquetra is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, showcasing its adaptability to humid climates.
